description: The Vive Tool is a command-line utility designed to facilitate the configuration and management of Windows features, specifically in preview builds. It allows system administrators to easily enable or disable specific features and functionalities, particularly useful for testing new capabilities in Windows environments. The tool can manipulate settings without requiring deep technical knowledge, making it accessible for organizations looking to experiment with and deploy new builds effectively. Administrators using this tool should download the latest preview release and follow the accompanying directions for setup. For easy deployment, configuration files in ADML and ADMX format can be downloaded from the web, streamlining feature management in corporate environments.
